intro: Masdevallia verrucosa, commonly known as the疣足兰, is a species of orchid native to the Andes of South America. It is characterized by its compact, epiphytic growth habit and its ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments. The plant features intricate, often hairy pseudobulbs and produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are typically narrow and arranged in a rosette pattern, and it blooms during the cooler months. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is a popular specimen among orchid enthusiasts and botanists.
